channel.title: NPC Moving and NPC Direction It is Facing?
channel.description:
Well, first off I am wanting my NPCS to move. I have read the guides, but they still won't move. Here is my code in autospawn.cfg [code]spawn = 3352 2610 3091 0 2609 3090 2611 3092 2 TZHAAR GUIDE[/code]
Second, I am wanting to change what direction the NPC is facing. Like, it is facing South right now, but I want it to face West. Anyway to change that?

item.title: NPC Moving and NPC Direction It is Facing?
item.dc:creator: @The_Prodigyscape The Prodigyscape
item.description:
@The_Prodigyscape wrote:

Owner Zerk:

For the second question… You can’t make NPC’s face a certain way. It’s like Runescape. When you login, everything is facing South/North. I can’t remember. Anyway. It’s like that, but it seems like you can change it because in Runescape things are constantly moving and changing. I guess Moparscape isn’t as powerful. Lul. I just made most of that btw. I’m just pretty sure you can’t make an NPC face a certain way.

You can but your autospawn.cfg would look way different from other peoples and you would probably have to code something somewhere else like client.java or something.
I’m sure it would be fairly easy but not for someone with low coding experiences.

Read full topic
item.source: NPC Moving and NPC Direction It is Facing?

item.title: NPC Moving and NPC Direction It is Facing?
item.dc:creator: @dragon_boy dragon boy
item.description:
@dragon_boy wrote:

[quote=“zubmage, post:2, topic:193547”]For NPCs to move its the opposite of safe zones. e.g you have to add North East Coords first, then South West.

As for the direction facing, I too would like to know.[/quote]
So, you are saying
This

spawn = 3352	2610	3091	0	2611	3092	2609	3090	2	TZHAAR GUIDE

Just to switch like this?

spawn = 3352	2610	3091	0	2609	3090	2611	3092	2	TZHAAR GUIDE

Read full topic
item.source: NPC Moving and NPC Direction It is Facing?

item.title: NPC Moving and NPC Direction It is Facing?
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

For NPCs to move its the opposite of safe zones. e.g you have to add North East Coords first, then South West.

As for the direction facing, I too would like to know.

Read full topic
